intro: Lomatia cymosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lomatia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, with woody stems and a generally compact form. Lomatia cymosa is also noted for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
